post.description:
This webhook is used to let you know that there's a new order or a status update of an existing order. In order to receive these events, you need to have a configured Order Events webhook. If we receive an error in the response then we'll try to retry the callback:

 - up to 6 minutes for ASAP orders,
 - up to 30 minutes for scheduled orders,

 We share an order event in our payloads. The following are all the valid values for it.

 Order Status | Description
 -------------|------------
 placed       | Order is placed in our system.
 rejected     | Order is rejected by site or automatically rejected due to lack of reaction from the restaurant.
 accepted     | Order is accepted by site.
 confirmed    | For scheduled orders only. Site has confirmed that they started preparing the order.
 canceled     | Order was canceled by site or customer.

 We'll send you this payload after a new order is placed or updated. This requires a configured Order Events webhook URL.

 Keep in mind that while every attempt is made to make callbacks in the order they occurred and in a timely manner, neither can be absolutely guaranteed. It is also possible to receive the same callback more than once. The status log should be treated as the source of truth when it comes to the order of the statuses.

 Please consult [Fulfillment Types](doc:fulfillment-types) page in Guides and see examples of requests on the right. See also other order types:
* [Scheduled Orders](doc:scheduled-orders)
* [Canceled Orders](doc:cancelled-orders)
* [Remake Orders](doc:remake-orders)

> ❗️ Order Preparation
>
> - All orders must be accepted (with `accepted` status present in the `status_log` in the event) before they are prepared.
> - For the vast majority of orders, the time you receive the order will be almost equal to the `start_preparing_at` timestamp.
> - Sometimes `start_preparing_at` may be far in the future (for example scheduled orders or when the site is close to closing). In these situations we recommend you wait until `start_preparing_at` before printing or showing the order in the kitchen
> - For the avoidance of doubt: preparation time is inclusive of any time required to accept the order

parameters.name: x-deliveroo-payload-type
parameters.description: Marks what event type is this request. Currently supported values are `event/order.new` and `event/order.status_update`. Please implement it as case-insensitive.

parameters.name: x-deliveroo-webhook-version
parameters.description: Marks which version of payload this request is having. Currently, all our payloads are version 1

brand_id.title: Brand ID
brand_id.description: The unique identifier for the brand.

display_id.title: Display ID
display_id.description: The ID we give to the site/rider/customer to easily identify the order.

allOf.description: Current status of the order. Can be placed, accepted, confirmed (for scheduled orders), rejected or canceled.

status_log.description: List of all statuses of the order with status type and time of occurrence.

at.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format when the order event changed.

allOf.description: Status of the order. Can be pending, placed, accepted, confirmed (for scheduled orders), rejected or canceled.

fulfillment_type.title: Fulfillment Type
fulfillment_type.description: Who will be collecting the order. Can be `deliveroo`, `restaurant`, `customer`, `table_service`, `autonomous`.

asap.description: False if the order is scheduled for a later time or the next day.

prepare_for.title: Prepare For
prepare_for.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format when the site should have the order prepared for rider to pickup.

table_number.title: Table Number
table_number.description: Number of customer's table. Only applies to Table Service orders.

allOf.description: Subtotal of items, excluding fees and discounts.
Information related to delivery. Only applies to restaurant fulfilled orders.

Total price for the order (including fees and discounts deducted). For Deliveroo fulfilled orders, fees = restaurant tip + item fees. For Restaurant fulfilled orders, fees = delivery fee + restaurant tip + item fees and surcharge.
The subtotal of the order after substitutions, excluding fees and discounts. I.e. the total price of menu_unit_price items and their modifiers.

The total of the order after substitutions, including fees and discounts. I.e. the total price of menu_unit_price items and their modifiers. For Deliveroo fulfilled orders, fees = restaurant tip + item fees. For Restaurant fulfilled orders, fees = delivery fee + restaurant tip + item fees and surcharge.
Discount to be applied to the total price of the order (value).
The amount the customer needs to pay in cash when the delivery arrives.
The amount for the bag fee that customer needs to pay.
The fee that makes up the difference if the total price is below the minimum order value.

fee_breakdown.description: This contains a list of individual fee descriptions.

items.description: An array of the Items in the order.

start_preparing_at.title: Start Preparing At
start_preparing_at.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format when the site should start preparing the order.

confirm_at.title: Confirm At
confirm_at.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format for when the site should confirm scheduled orders by. May still be NULL for scheduled orders, if the order is placed close to the scheduled delivery time (and the site must start preparing immediately). Only applies to scheduled order type.

promotions.description: Contains the promotions associated with the order. If the order does not have a promotion applied then this section is not in payload.

parent_order_id.title: Parent Order ID
parent_order_id.description: Unique ID of the original order.

fault.title: Fault
fault.description: Defines who caused the redelivery, and affects the total_price. Possible values are "deliveroo" (total_price will be 100%) and "restaurant" (total_price will be 0).

order_cost.title: Order Cost
order_cost.description: The price of the order before fault is applied.

is_tabletless.title: Is Tablet-less
is_tabletless.description: Flags if site is using tablet or not.

provider.description: Meal card provider used in order. Please mind that the list is not conclusive.

amount.description: Amount for order paid via meal card. Represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

allOf.description: Information about the customer.

allOf.title: Customer Details
allOf.description: Information about the customer.

first_name.title: First Name
first_name.description: Customer first name. Deliveroo fulfilled and pickup orders only.

contact_number.title: Contact Number
contact_number.description: A third party number used to contact customers. Deliveroo fulfilled and pickup orders only.

contact_access_code.title: Contact Access Code
contact_access_code.description: The access code needed to use the third party number to contact customers. Deliveroo fulfilled and pickup orders only.

order_frequency_at_site.title: Order Frequency At Site
order_frequency_at_site.description: Customer order frequency at a given site. This is free text and shouldn't be considered an enum.

loyalty.title: Loyalty
loyalty.description: Loyalty information attached to the order

card_number.title: Card Number
card_number.description: Loyalty card number of the user

loyalty_id.title: Loyalty ID
loyalty_id.description: Loyalty identifier (card number or email) of the user

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback.

4XX.description: Your server can return 4XX codes to signal its issues with the request.

5XX.description: Your server can return 5XX codes to signal its internal issues.

post.description:
This webhook is used to let you know that there's an update on rider status. In order to receive these events, you need to have a configured Rider Events webhook. If we receive an error in the response then we'll try to retry the callback up to 10 minutes. Usually a regular rider status lifecycle is `rider_assigned` => `rider_arrived` (at the restaurant).

The following are all the valid values for a rider status.

 Rider Status                  | Description
 ------------------------------|------------
 rider_assigned                | Rider was assigned to the order.
 rider_arrived                 | Rider nearby to the site.
 rider_confirmed_at_restaurant | Rider arrival at the site confirmed on rider's app.
 rider_unassigned              | Rider was unassigned from the order.
 rider_in_transit              | Rider is on the way to the customer.
 Keep in mind that while every attempt is made to make callbacks in the order they occurred and in a timely manner, neither can be absolutely guaranteed. It is also possible to receive the same callback more than once. The status log should be treated as the source of truth when it comes to the order of the statuses.

parameters.name: x-deliveroo-payload-type
parameters.description: Marks what event type is this request. Currently supported values is `event/rider.status_update`. Please implement it as case-insensitive.

stacked_with.title: Stacked With
stacked_with.description: Array containing unique ids of orders stacked with this order.

riders.title: Riders
riders.description: Array containing one or more rider objects.

estimated_arrival_time.title: Estimated Arrival Time
estimated_arrival_time.description: Estimated time when the rider will arrive at the site.

full_name.title: Full Name
full_name.description: Always sent as "Deliveroo Rider” as rider anonymization has been enabled

contact_number.title: Contact Number
contact_number.description: A third party number used to contact riders.

bridge_code.title: Bridge Code
bridge_code.description: When rider's have their phone number masked, this value should be used when calling their temporary phone number.

bridge_number.title: Bridge Number
bridge_number.description: As riders can have their personal phone numbers protected (masked), a temporary phone number and code will be assigned to bridge number.

status_log.description: Array containing one or more status_log object.

at.description: Timestamp when the given event occurred in ISO-8601 format.

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback.

4XX.description: Your server can return 4XX codes to signal its issues with the request.

5XX.description: Your server can return 5XX codes to signal its internal issues.

post.description:
**This webhook is deprecated, please see [Order Events webhook](ref:order-events-webhook-1)**

 Here you'll find the keys and values you can expect in payloads for new orders and remakes. Your webhook should listen for these events, triggered when the order is accepted by the site on their deliveroo tablet, via Picking API or via the Order Update API endpoint.

 New Deliveroo order payloads **can vary** depending on fulfillment types.

 Please consult [Fulfillment Types](doc:fulfillment-types) page in Guides and see examples of requests on the right. See also other order types:
* [Scheduled Orders](doc:scheduled-orders)
* [Remake Orders](doc:remake-orders)

 We're using same webhook url for `new_order` and `cancel_order` event.

parameters.name: x-deliveroo-sequence-guid
parameters.description: Deliveroo Sequential globally unique identifier (GUID). Please implement it as case-insensitive.

parameters.name: x-deliveroo-hmac-sha256
parameters.description: On registration, we'll provide you with a webhook secret. We'll use the webhook secret and a sequential globally unique identifier (GUID) to generate a hash of the order payload. When you receive a POST request, you will be able to compute a hash and verify that it's a genuine, authorized request sent from Deliveroo. Please implement it as case-insensitive.

event.title: Event type
event.description: The name of the event. In this case new_order

restaurant_acknowledged_at.title: Site Acknowledged At
restaurant_acknowledged_at.description: Date and time when the site accepted the order on the Deliveroo tablet in the ISO-8601 format

display_id.title: Display ID
display_id.description: The ID we give to the site/rider/customer to easily identify the order.

order_number.title: Order Number
order_number.description: Deliveroo's complete order ID. This field will be deprecated in future. It is a String field and shouldn't be parsed as numeric. It contains string values of unsigned int64.

allOf.description: The amount paid by the customer, Including item deposit fees.
The subtotal of the order after substitutions + item deposit fees, excluding other fees and discounts. I.e. the total price of menu_unit_price items and their modifiers + item deposit fees.

fee_breakdown.description: This contains a list of individual fee descriptions.

items.title: FeeDescription
items.description: Describes the part of the overall fees applied to the order

type.description: The value of the item fee type represent type of fees applied (e.g. DEPOSIT_FEE).

fractional.description: The value of the monetary amount represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

currency_code.description: The international 3-letter code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard.

allOf.description: Myltibuy offer amount value

quantity.description: Number of items in the bundle

items.description: An array of the Items in the order.

pos_item_id.title: In-Store System Item ID
pos_item_id.description: The ID of the item in the in-store system. Value can also be null. If null, this will generate an `unknown_pos_item_id_error` field in the order payload as well.

operational_name.title: Operational Name
operational_name.description: Operational name the site uses in-house for the item.

allOf.description: Price per unit.
Total price of the item, including unit price and the modifiers' price.
Price per unit according to the menu (can be different from Unit Price in case of more expensive substitutions, for example)
Return eligible containers to a return point to get your deposit refund.

type.description: The value of the item fee type represent type of fees applied (e.g. DEPOSIT_FEE).

fractional.description: The value of the monetary amount represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

currency_code.description: The international 3-letter code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard.

modifiers.title: Modifiers
modifiers.description: Predefined preparation instructions that must be communicated to kitchen as well as food or drink items that might accompany a menu item, e.g. No tomato. You can have modifiers of modifiers.

pos_item_id.title: In-Store System Item ID
pos_item_id.description: The ID of the item in the in-store system. Value can also be null. If null, this will generate an unknown_pos_item_id_error field in the order payload as well.

operational_name.title: Operational Name
operational_name.description: Operational name the site uses in-house for the item.

allOf.description: Price per unit.
Price per unit according to the menu (can be different from Unit Price in case of more expensive substitutions, for example)
Total price for the item & modifiers (without discounts).
The discounted amount applied.
Return eligible containers to a return point to get your deposit refund.

modifiers.title: Modifiers
modifiers.description: Predefined preparation instructions that must be communicated to kitchen as well as food or drink items that might accompany a menu item, e.g. No tomato. You can have modifiers of modifiers.

allOf.description: The discounted amount applied.

asap.title: ASAP
asap.description: False if the order is scheduled for a later time or the next day.

fulfillment_type.title: Fulfillment Type
fulfillment_type.description: Who will be collecting the order. Can be `deliveroo`, `restaurant`, `customer`, `table_service`, `autonomous`

allOf.description: The amount the customer needs to pay in cash when the delivery arrives.
The fee that makes up the difference if the total price is below the minimum order value.
The bag fee amount for the order, paid by the partner.

fractional.description: The value of the monetary amount represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

currency_code.description: The international 3-letter code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard.

allOf.description: Discount to be applied to the total price of the order (value).

pickup_at.title: Pickup At
pickup_at.description: The time the Deliveroo rider will pick up the order in ISO-8601 format.

allOf.description: The cost of delivery service.

line1.title: Line1
line1.description: First line of address info the customer enters at checkout like street name and number.

line2.title: Line2
line2.description: Second line of address info the customer enters at checkout like building number.

city.title: City
city.description: The town or city the customer enters at checkout.

postcode.title: Postcode
postcode.description: The postcode of the town or city the customer enters at checkout.

contact_number.title: Contact Number
contact_number.description: A third party number used to contact customers.

contact_access_code.title: Contact Access Code
contact_access_code.description: The access code needed to use the third party number to contact customers.

deliver_by.title: Deliver By
deliver_by.description: Date and time when the order should be delivered by in the ISO-8601 format.

customer_name.title: Customer Name
customer_name.description: First name and the first letter of surname of the customer.

promotions.description: Contains the promotions associated with the order. If the order does not have a promotion applied then this section is not in payload.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of promotion applied to the offer. It can be percentage_off_on_items or percentage_off_on_basket.

value.title: Value
value.description: A integer representing the percentage of discount applied to the order.

fractional.description: The value of the monetary amount represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

currency_code.description: The international 3-letter code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard.

pos_item_ids.title: In-Store System Item IDs
pos_item_ids.description: A list of items in the order affected by the promotion.

id.title: ID
id.description: The ID of the item in the in-store system.

parent_order_id.title: Parent Order ID
parent_order_id.description: Unique ID of the original order.

fault.title: Fault
fault.description: Defines who caused the redelivery, and affects the total_price. Possible values are "deliveroo" (total_price will be 100%) and "restaurant" (total_price will be 0).

order_cost.title: Order Cost
order_cost.description: The price of the order before fault is applied.

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback.

4XX.description: Your server can return 4XX codes to signal its issues with the request.

5XX.description: Your server can return 5XX codes to signal its internal issues.

post.description:
**This webhook is deprecated, please see [Order Events webhook](ref:order-events-webhook-1)**

Here you'll find the keys and values you can expect in payloads for cancelled orders. Your webhook should listen for these events, triggered when the order is accepted by the site on their deliveroo tablet, via Picking API or via the Order Update API endpoint.

 Please consult [Fulfillment Types](doc:fulfillment-types) page in Guides and see examples of requests on the right. See also [Canceled Orders](doc:cancelled-orders).

We're using same webhook url for `new_order` and `cancel_order` event.

event.title: Event type
event.description: The name of the event. In this case `cancel_order`.

cancelled_at.title: Cancelled At
cancelled_at.description: Date and time when the customer cancelled the order in the ISO-8601 format.

order_number.title: Order Number
order_number.description: Deliveroo's complete order ID. This field will be deprecated in future. It is a String field and shouldn't be parsed as numeric. It contains string values of unsigned int64.

display_id.title: Display ID
display_id.description: The ID we give to the site/rider/customer to easily identify the order.

pickup_at.title: Pickup At
pickup_at.description: The time the Deliveroo rider will pick up the order in ISO-8601 format.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: The reason why Deliveroo is cancelling the order. Can be `deliveroo_cancelled`.

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback.

4XX.description: Your server can return 4XX codes to signal its issues with the request.

5XX.description: Your server can return 5XX codes to signal its internal issues.

post.summary: Create Sync Status for an Order
post.description:
Use this endpoint to tell us if the order has been successfully sent to the site's in-store system. If the status is `failed`, use the reason and notes values to tell us why.

 **If we don't receive your sync status after 3 minutes, or we receive a `failed` status, we'll send a message to the Deliveroo tablet prompting staff to check their in-store system for the order, and enter manually into the till if needed.**

 Once we've received a sync status (or the timeout occurs), any attempts to update it will give you an HTTP 409.

 **We don't require sync status calls for sites marked as tabletless.** If such a site is using Deliveroo tablet and some orders will fail to be synchronized, the tablet will not show notifications about the failures.

 This endpoint is rate limited at 1 request per 10s per order.

status.description: Status of the sync status. Can be `succeeded` or `failed`.

reason.description: Required if the status is failed. This explains why the order could not be sent to the in-store system in the site.

notes.description: Free text field to provide more information as to why the order failed to reach the in-store system. e.g. which items or prices were wrong.

occurred_at.description: Time the sync status was received in the ISO-8601 format.

FailedSyncStatusWithNotes.summary: Sync Status With Failed Status and notes

post.summary: Create Preparation Stage for an Order
post.description: You can use this endpoint if you have a kitchen management system and want to update Deliveroo on how the preparation of the order is going. ([detailed guide](doc:prep-stages-endpoint))

stage.description:
One of the possible preparation stage:
 - in_kitchen (Cooking has started)
 - ready_for_collection_soon (Food is a maximum of 60s from being ready to collect)
 - ready_for_collection (Food is cooked and packaged)
 - collected (The order has been collected)

occurred_at.description: The date/time (ISO-8601) the event occurred in UTC. Value must be within 1 hour in past from current UTC date/time or within 5 minutes in future from current UTC date/time. e.g. if current date/time is 15:00 occurred_at must be between 14:00 and 15:05

delay.description:
Optional requested delay to prep time. Value must be either 0, 2, 4, 6, 8 or 10.

Any requested delay should be used with the `in_kitchen` prep stage.

patch.description:
Allows a user to accept or reject an order and confirm a scheduled one. This should be called only once per order and can only be used by partners with a configured Order Events webhook.

 On successful response, you'll receive 204 No Content (204 status code and response without body). This will mean that the order status was changed within Deliveroo systems. For failed requests, we'll send the appropriate status code with a message including a reason. If you don't accept an ASAP order in 10 minutes (7 for Kuwait and UAE markets) then it will get rejected automatically.

 This endpoint is rate limited at 5 request per min per order.

 List of allowed order status transitions:

 Transition            | Description
 ----------------------|--------------------
 placed => accepted    | Accepting an order.
 placed => rejected    | Rejecting an order.
 accepted => confirmed | Site confirms an order and is starting to prepare it. Only applies to scheduled order type.
 This endpoint is rate limited at 5 request per min per order.

status.title: Order Status
status.description: Operation type. `accepted` to accept an order, `rejected` to reject it or `confirmed` to confirm a scheduled order that was accepted before.

reject_reason.title: Reject Reason
reject_reason.description: Reason for order rejection. Can be `closing_early`, `busy`, `ingredient_unavailable` or `other`. Required if status is `rejected`

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Free text to give more information why order was rejected.

409.description: We'll return `409 Conflict` status code if sync status was already sent to us or the timeout occurred.

error.message: This sync status has already been finalized

get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a single order using the unique order ID.

You can use this endpoint to check order-level data for any order using its ID. Don't include the curly brackets {} when you make the GET request - just add the order ID.

created_at.description: Time we created the order in the ISO-8601 format.
created_at.title: Created At

id.description: Unique ID of the order event.

event_type.description: Type of order event. Can be `ACCEPTED` or `CANCELLED`

payload.description: Details of the order sent to the in-store system company, used to create the order on their system.

sent_at.description: Time we sent the order in the ISO-8601 format.

status.description: Status of the sync status. Can be `succeeded` or `failed`.

reason.description: Required if the status is failed. This explains why the order could not be sent to the in-store system in the site.

notes.description: Free text field to provide more information as to why the order failed to reach the in-store system. e.g. which items or prices were wrong.

occurred_at.description: Time the sync status was received in the ISO-8601 format.

id.description: Unique ID of the sync status.

order_event_id.description: Unique ID of the order event.

400.description: The request didn't work, often because a required parameter is missing or the content-type hasn't been set e.g. an incorrect JSON request

401.description: The request didn't work because the combination of your API key and API token doesn't exist in our system or your integration has been disabled

404.description: Order with that ID was not found in our systems.

500.description: Something went wrong on our end. You'll have to try again later once we've fixed it.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Beginning of the time range to search in. ISO8601 compliant date-time string.

parameters.name: date_end
parameters.description: End of the time range to search in. ISO8601 compliant date-time string.

get.description:
Return a list of up to 100 orders for a given location within a given timeframe.

 There are several ways to make the GET request by timeframe. Don't include the curly brackets {} when you make the GET request - just add your in-store system ID and substitute the example dates and times for the ones you want to query.

 Example GET requests:

 `GET api/v1/{site_location_id}/orders?date=2018-12-11`

 See all orders on a certain date. This example would show all orders on 11 December 2018.

 `GET api/v1/{site_location_id}/orders?date=2018-12-11T15:00`

 See all orders on a certain date from a certain time. This example would show all orders between 15:00 and the end of the day on 11 December 2018.

 `GET api/v1/{site_location_id}/orders?date=2018-12-11&date_end=2018-12-13`

 See all orders from the beginning of a certain date to the end of another. This example would show all orders from the beginning of 11 December 2018 to the end of 13 December 2018.

 `GET api/v1/{site_location_id}/orders?date=2018-12-11T15:00&date_end=2018-12-13`

 See orders from a certain time on a certain date to the end of another date. This example would show all orders from 15:00 on 11 December 2018 to the end of the day on 13 December 2018.

 `GET api/v1/{site_location_id}/orders?date=2018-12-11T15:00&date_end=2018-12-13T16:21`

 See orders from a certain time on a certain date to a certain time on another date. This example would show all orders from 15:00 on 11 December 2018 to 16:21 on 13 December 2018.

get.summary: Get Integrator's Order Events Webhook Configuration
get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve order events webhook URL.

put.summary: Change Integrator's Order Events Webhook Configuration
put.description:
This endpoint allows you to update order events webhook URL.

Please remember to update site's settings if you're migrating to Order Events Webhook. See [Update Site Config endpoint](ref:put-sites-config).

allOf.description: URL for the webhook (blank to remove webhook)

get.summary: Get Integrator's Rider Events Webhook configuration
get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve rider events webhook URL.

put.summary: Change Integrator's Rider Events Webhook configuration
put.description: This endpoint allows you to update rider events webhook URL.

allOf.description: URL for the webhook (blank to remove webhook)

get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the current settings for webhook URL in use for sites under the given brand.

200.description: Get sites webhook config success response.

put.description:
This endpoint allows you to update the type of webhook used by sites under the integrator brand.

Please find more information about OAuth Migration in public documentation [here](https://sites.google.com/deliveroo.co.uk/integration-migration/home).

allOf.description: List of sites to update.

get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of a single order using the unique order ID.

 Deliveroo would not return order data older than 30 days.

 You can use this endpoint to check order-level data for any order using its ID.

 This endpoint is rate limited at 1 request per second per order.

order_number.title: Order Numeric ID
order_number.description: Deliveroo's complete order ID. This field will be deprecated in future. It is a String field and shouldn't be parsed as numeric. It contains string values of unsigned int64.

brand_id.title: Brand ID
brand_id.description: The unique identifier for the brand.

display_id.title: Display ID
display_id.description: The ID we give to the site/rider/customer to easily identify the order.

allOf.description: Current status of the order. Can be placed, accepted, confirmed (for scheduled orders), rejected or canceled.

status_log.title: Status Log
status_log.description: List of all statuses of the order with status type and time of occurrence.

at.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format when the order event changed.

allOf.description: Status of the order. Can be pending, placed, accepted, confirmed (for scheduled orders), rejected or canceled.

fulfillment_type.title: Fulfillment Type
fulfillment_type.description: Who will be collecting the order. Can be `deliveroo`, `restaurant`, `customer`, `table_service`, `autonomous`.

asap.description: False if the order is scheduled for a later time or the next day.

prepare_for.title: Prepare For
prepare_for.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format when the site should have the order prepared for rider to pickup.

table_number.title: Table Number
table_number.description: Number of customer's table. Only applies to Table Service orders.

allOf.description: Subtotal of items, excluding fees and discounts.
Information related to delivery. Only applies to restaurant fulfilled orders.

allOf.title: Delivery Details
allOf.description: Details of the delivery.

line1.title: Line 1
line1.description: First line of address info the customer enters at checkout like street name and number.

line2.title: Line 2
line2.description: Second line of address info the customer enters at checkout like building number.

city.title: City
city.description: The town or city the customer enters at checkout.

postcode.title: Postcode
postcode.description: The postcode of the town or city the customer enters at checkout.

contact_number.title: Contact Number
contact_number.description: A third party number used to contact customers.

contact_access_code.title: Contact Access Code
contact_access_code.description: The access code needed to use the third party number to contact customers.

deliver_by.title: Deliver By
deliver_by.description: Date and time when the order should be delivered by in the ISO-8601 format.

customer_name.title: Customer Name
customer_name.description: Name and first letter of surname of the customer.

allOf.description: The cost of delivery service.

Total price for the order (including fees and discounts deducted). For Deliveroo fulfilled orders, fees = restaurant tip + item fees. For Restaurant fulfilled orders, fees = delivery fee + restaurant tip + item fees and surcharge.
The subtotal of the order after substitutions, excluding fees and discounts. I.e. the total price of menu_unit_price items and their modifiers.

The total of the order after substitutions, including fees and discounts. I.e. the total price of menu_unit_price items and their modifiers. For Deliveroo fulfilled orders, fees = restaurant tip + item fees. For Restaurant fulfilled orders, fees = delivery fee + restaurant tip + item fees and surcharge.
Discount to be applied to the total price of the order (value).
The amount the customer needs to pay in cash when the delivery arrives.
The amount for the bag fee that customer needs to pay.
The fee that makes up the difference if the total price is below the minimum order value.

fee_breakdown.title: Provides the values of individual types of fee.
fee_breakdown.description: This contains a list of individual fee descriptions.

allOf.title: FeeDescription
allOf.description: Describes the part of the overall fees applied to the order

type.description: The value of the item fee type represent type of fees applied (e.g. DEPOSIT_FEE).

fractional.description: The value of the monetary amount represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

currency_code.description: The international 3-letter code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard.

items.title: Items
items.description: An array of the Items in the order.

start_preparing_at.title: Start Preparing At
start_preparing_at.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format when the site should start preparing the order.

confirm_at.title: Confirm At
confirm_at.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format for when the site should confirm scheduled orders by. May still be NULL for scheduled orders, if the order is placed close to the scheduled delivery time (and the site must start preparing immediately). Only applies to scheduled order type.

promotions.title: Promotions
promotions.description: Contains the promotions associated with the order. If the order does not have a promotion applied then this section is not in payload.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of promotion applied to the offer. It can be `percentage_off_on_items` or `percentage_off_on_basket`.

value.title: Value
value.description: A integer representing the percentage of discount applied to the order.

fractional.description: The value of the monetary amount represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

currency_code.description: The international 3-letter code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard.

allOf.description: Myltibuy offer amount value

quantity.description: Number of items in the bundle

pos_item_ids.title: In-Store System Item IDs
pos_item_ids.description: A list of items in the order affected by the promotion.

id.title: ID
id.description: The ID of the item in the in-store system.

parent_order_id.title: Parent Order ID
parent_order_id.description: Unique ID of the original order.

fault.title: Fault
fault.description: Defines who caused the redelivery, and affects the total_price. Possible values are "deliveroo" (total_price will be 100%) and "restaurant" (total_price will be 0).

order_cost.title: Order Cost
order_cost.description: The price of the order before fault is applied.

is_tabletless.title: Is Tabletless
is_tabletless.description: Flags if site is using tablet or not.

provider.description: Meal card provider used in order. Please mind that the list is not conclusive.

amount.description: Amount for order paid via meal card. Represented in the fractional or subunit of the currency (e.g. pence, cents).

customer_order_count.title: Customer Order Count
customer_order_count.description: The number of orders placed by the customer of this order with this restaurant. This count includes only orders in statuses DELIVERED and PICKED_UP_BY_CUSTOMER.

card_number.description: The loyalty card number associated to the user. If the loyalty card number is not associated this field will be an empty string.

loyalty_id.description: The loyalty identifier (card number or email) associated to the user. If no loyalty identifier is associated, this field will be an empty string.

parameters.name: brand_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the brand (Deliveroo's integration team will provide this).

parameters.name: restaurant_id
parameters.description: ID of the restaurant to get orders for.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Beginning of the time range to search in. ISO8601 compliant date-time string.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End of the time range to search in. ISO8601 compliant date-time string.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: A cursor to retrieve the next page of results. This is returned in the `next` field of response for the previous page of results.

parameters.name: live_orders
parameters.description:
**\*This feature is experimental and may not be available for all Integration Partners.\***
A value of "true" will return only live orders. Orders are "live" if they meet two criteria: 1. Their status is `placed`, `accepted`, or `confirmed` 2. The order has not yet been picked up by a rider or customer

get.description:
Return a list of up to 100 orders for a given restaurant within a given timeframe.

 Deliveroo would not return order data older than 30 days.

 There are several ways to make the GET request by timeframe.

 Example GET requests:

 `GET api/v2/brand/{brand_id}/restaurant/{restaurant_id}/orders?start_date=2018-12-11T00:00:00Z`

 See all orders on and after a certain date. This example would show all orders on and after 11 December 2018.

 `GET api/v2/brand/{brand_id}/restaurant/{restaurant_id}/orders?start_date=2018-12-11T00:00:00Z&end_date=2018-12-13T23:59:00Z`

 See all orders between start date and end date. This example would show all orders from the beginning of 11 December 2018 to the end of 13 December 2018.

 `GET api/v2/brand/{brand_id}/restaurant/{restaurant_id}/orders?cursor=eyJzdGFydF9kYXRlIjoiMjAxOC0xMi0xMVQwMDowMDowMCIsImVuZF9kYXRlIjoiMjAxOC0xMi0xMlQwMDowMDowMCIsIm1pbl9vcmRlcl9pZCI6IjA3ZmJiODJhLWNlYjUtNDNlYy0xMjNmLTE4YWY4OWUzMzgwYSJ9`

 See all order after the previous call, cursor will be returned as `next` in response if there are more than 100 orders in a window.

 This endpoint is rate limited at 5 request per minute per restaurant.

next.description: Cursor for the next page if there are more than 100 orders
